Package remodel.meta

Class Concept

java.lang.Object
remodel.meta.Nominal
remodel.meta.Namespace<Property>
remodel.meta.Concept
public class Concept
extends Namespace<Property>
Concept denotes a named concept defined within a ReMoDeL metamodel. A Concept has a name, which is fixed after creation, and is used to index the Concept in its owning Metamodel. A Concept defines a number of named Properties. Each Property is either an Attribute, Component, Reference or Operation. An Attribute is a simply-typed Property, having one of the basic ReMoDeL types in: {Integer, Real, String, Character, Boolean}. A Component is an owned strong reference to another Concept. A Reference is a weak reference to another Concept. An Operation is a computed or derived Property with an executable body.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

    • Concept

      public Concept​(java.lang.String name, boolean flag)
      Creates a predefined Concept with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of this Concept.
      flag - a flag indicating predefined.

    • Concept

      public Concept​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String parent)
      Creates a Concept with the given name and parent name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of this Concept.
      parent - the name of its parent Concept.

  • Method Details

    • getMetamodel

      public Metamodel getMetamodel()
      Returns:
      the Metamodel owning this Concept.

    • setMetamodel

      public void setMetamodel​(Metamodel owner)
      Sets the Metamodel owning this Concept. Invoked reciprocally when this Concept is added to a Metamodel.
      Parameters:
      owner - the owning Metamodel.

    • getParent

      public Concept getParent()
      Looks up the parent Concept of this Concept by name, in the same Metamodel.
      Returns:
      the parent Concept of this Concept, if it exists.

    • getAncestors

      public java.util.List<Concept> getAncestors()
      Returns the ancestors of this Concept. The result is a List of Concepts, in order of general to specific, finishing with this Concept.
      Returns:
      an ordered List of this Concept's ancestry.

    • addProperty

      public void addProperty​(Property property)
      Adds a Property to this Concept.
      Parameters:
      property - the Property to add.

    • getProperty

      public Property getProperty​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the locally defined Property with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Property.
      Returns:
      the Property, or null.

    • getProperties

      public java.util.List<Property> getProperties()
      Returns a list of this Concept's locally defined Properties, in the order that they were added. Returns all user-defined Properties in this Concept, but ignores predefined Properties.
      Returns:
      a list of Properties.

    • getAllProperties

      public java.util.List<Property> getAllProperties()
      Returns a list of all of this Concept's inherited and locally defined Properties, in the order that they were defined. Later definitions may override earlier ones. Returns all user-defined Properties that were inherited or local, but ignores predefined Properties.
      Returns:
      a list of all inherited and local Properties.

    • findProperty

      public Property findProperty​(java.lang.String name) throws SemanticError
      Looks up a Property by name, starting in this Concept and proceeding to its ancestors, if it has a parent Concept.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the sought Property.
      Returns:
      the Property.
      Throws:
      SemanticError - if no Property can be found.

    • findConcept

      public Concept findConcept​(java.lang.String type) throws SemanticError
      Looks up a Concept by its type in the current context.
      Parameters:
      type - the type name of the Concept.
      Returns:
      the Concept.
      Throws:
      SemanticError - if no Concept can be found.
